WorkItem.Description:
It seems like Rawr isnt taking the full buff's from Talents.
 
Arcane Focus - Increases Chance To Hit and reduces mana cost of Arcane spells by 3%
Precision - Reduces the Mana cost and chance to with spells by 3%
 
I had loaded up Rawr and loaded my Character from Armory. At the same time I disabled all buffs and only added the buffs my mages uses.
 
- Arcane intelligence
- Molten Armor
 
with a 281 Hit rating Rawr says I was at 11% Hit Rating and 70+ Hit rating undercap. When in game it say I have 281 Hit rating and chance to hit 8%. I dont think Rawr is getting the Hit Buff from Precision in the Frost tree and I know that it covers all class spells.
Maybe someone can take a look into it ?!

Comments.Message: 8% is the part that applies to all spells, 3% from Arcane Focus applies to arcane only.

What I was trying to say is that 

- in game I have a Hit Rating of 281 ( 8% )
- In Rawr it says I have a Hit Rating of 281 ( but 11% )
The 11% includes the 3% from Precision since it applies to all spells (11=8+3).

See this is what I dont understand. In Rawr I put my Mage spec into the Talent tree the 3 points into Arcane Focus and 3 into Precision as well did it Gearless .. and it showed up with only having 3% Hit .. so isnt it sappose to have 6% ?
No. Read what you just wrote.
I just uploaded mine and its off what my hit should be, im sitting at 252 which is 9.84% in game. Rawr is adding in only 1 of the 3% talents hes shown above putting me at 12.84%.
This is getting absurd. There is a * next to that hit% number. The main one shows hit that is applied to all spells, for school specific number mouse over the * and read the tooltip.
